page.title: 01ASHRIDGE ESTATE
page.content: The twelve kilometre squares we were given for our project contains much of the Ashridge Estate which is maintained by the National Trust. It is one of the lovely wooded estates of the Chiltern Hills and has many historical connections. The only settlement of any size is the village of Aldbury the other building being Ashridge itself the former stately home of the Dukes of Bridgwater and now a Management College. Woodlands cover the vast majority of all but two squares and the most common tree is the beech. There is some farming which will be included and a visit to the village school at Aldbury.
